verses.roman:
yathāhaṁ praṇame viprān
anukālaṁ samāhitaḥ
tathā namata yūyaṁ ca
yo 'nyathā me sa daṇḍa-bhāk

synonyms: yathā—as; aham—I; praṇame—bow down; viprān—to brāhmaṇas; anu-kālam—all the time; samāhitaḥ—carefully; tathā—so; namata—should bow down; yūyam—all of you; ca—also; yaḥ—one who; anyathā—(does) otherwise; me—by Me; saḥ—he; daṇḍa—for punishment; bhāk—a candidate.
translation: Just us I always carefully bow down to brāhmaṇas, so all of you should likewise bow down to them. I will punish anyone who acts otherwise.
